channel.title: Dream Bench Blog | Dream Bench
channel.description: We bring you the news you need to know about the ever changing ecosystem

item.title: BEHOLD ZUNGERU...THE PLACE WHERE NIGERIA WAS BORN
item.description:
For a long part of my life, I have always wondered why Lord Frederick Lugard amalgamated the Northern and Southern protectorates into what became Nigeria, immediately the people shouted “happy new year” in 1914. Even if he had signed, couldn’t his secretary and the man whose name gave us Port-Harcourt, Lord Harcourt have read out something else?   

Why did his queen, Flora Shaw, give us the name Nigeria; a name that sourced from the phrase Niger –area?

 Had she given us a name like Slaveria---probably from the combination of the words ‘slave and area’, would our fathers have done anything?

There must have been something wonderful about the people of the community where this whole thing happened.

item.title: IGHO SANOMI; AFRICA'S YOUNGEST BILLIONAIRE
item.description: Igho Charles Sanomi II was born in 1975 in Agbor Delta State, Nigeria, the fifth child (and first son) of a devout Catholic family. His father, the late Dickens Oghenereumu Patrick Sanomi hailed from Delta State Nigeria and was a retired Assistant Inspector General of the Nigerian Police. Mr Sanomi’s mother, Mabel Iyabo Sanomi holds a Royal title of Yeye Jemo of Isotun Ijesha Kingdom in Osun State. She was a renowned nurse and medical entrepreneur from Osun State in South Western Nigeria.

item.title: 2014 FASHION TRENDS
item.description:
Dear Friends,

'Looking good is good business!' they say, check out these lovely fashion items designed to stand you out and make you look adorable in 2014.

They are nice!

item.title: WHAT IS CHRISTIANITY?
item.description:
There is a widespread belief that Christianity is a religion! Religion is the effort and attempt by mankind to seek God and establish a relationship with God. Hence, with religion there are several types, beliefs, procedures and means put in place by mankind to reach God. A religious person thus believes all religions have the capacity to reach God and maintain a good relationship with Him.

All religions also believe in the purity and righteousness of God, hence, they all believe reaching God and maintaining a good relationship with him is through morals, keeping rules and regulations, being upright and doing the right thing and generally upholding the law of good conscience.

Mankind has over time developed this concept called religion due to an innate conviction and natural instinct that there is a supreme being somewhere, bigger and more powerful than man who rules and controls the affairs of this world; the whole creation and nature. For man to therefore feel safe, secure, happy and protected, he must seek the protection, goodwill and kindness of this Supreme Being, hence religion became man’s answer.

item.title: The best way to run your business meeting in 2014 revealed!
item.description:
In this super-fast age of ours, good meeting etiquette is a necessity if any business must come good.

Quite often, organizations hold meetings within which strategies and business ideas are analyzed. But all too often, meetings run longer than necessary and consequently fail to keep attendees engaged.

Whether you're meeting with partners, vendors or employees, showcase your boardroom brilliance with these meeting musts:

  •   Determine the objectives. A clear goal will set the tone for the meeting and determine its direction. Your goal should be specific and measurable. If you're expecting attendees to brainstorm, ask each participant to arrive with a list of ideas.

 

  •   Ask yourself if a meeting is actually necessary. Meetings can be expensive. To calculate the precise cost, multiply the hourly wage of each person present by the length of the gathering. If your objective can be met through e-mail, conference call, Skype, or even a quick one-on-one discussion, skip the meeting altogether.

item.title: TODAY ON FRANKLY SPEAKING - THE CORE OF THE MATTER.
item.description:
Many businesses today are under tremendous pressure and anxiety about where their growth will come from this year. Teams are meeting, putting together plans and strategies for success. Competitors are also planning on how they can take on a larger share of the market; deliver more in volume, revenue and profit.

The dynamism and inconsistencies in the market and business environment keep making it difficult for business leaders to chest-beat about good profit at the end of the financial year. The quality, commitment and passion of employees also put a question mark on the likelihood of fully implementing strategy and delivering the expected results.

 Truth is, many people today are just going to work, doing their best and hoping for the best. Very few are actually confident about success at the end of the period.

item.title: REAL ESTATE BUSINESS SET TO BOOM IN KENYA!
item.description:
Are you looking for where to invest in 2014?

The Kenyan Government has, once again, reiterated its readiness to partner with the private sector in order to construct and sell houses.

In Kenya, there has been a robust growth in housing development in the last five years. Nonetheless, there remains a very high and unmet demand - particularly in the urban areas across the country which shelters over 1.8million visitors annually!

Under the Vision 2030, a target of over 200,000 housing units per year is required.

As such, the government is ready to work out modalities of partnering with private sector to construct and sell houses, including low cost houses to Kenyans.

 ‘Safari land’ calls.

This might just be your chance to strike gold!

item.title: 6 PHRASES YOU SHOULD NEVER USE AT THE OFFICE
item.description:
The corporate world is increasingly sieving out every form of ethical informality. 

Listed below are my top six suggestions for the “DO NOT SAY” list. Using these comments in business (and life) can diminish your stature in the eyes of others, minimize what you are saying, or tarnish your professional image

item.title: TODAY ON FRANKLY SPEAKING - YOUR LIFE'S WORK; A MASTERPIECE
item.description:
If you sincerely open your eyes and look around, if you refuse to let your subjective mindset and restricting thinking cover your true sight, you’ll realize more than ever before in history, this millennium offers the greatest opportunities to achieve whatever you want to achieve and be the best you can ever be in life.

Today, we have no more barriers and restriction in business and social communication globally, information on any subject matter is just a click away, opportunities abound across markets, across nations, across the globe, individual liberty has become more popular and indeed we are enjoying an era of free enterprise.

Success, freedom, happiness and financial independence has never been more accessible anytime else in history than now!

item.title: TODAY ON FRANKLY SPEAKING - CONFRONTERS AND EVADERS.
item.description:
Many years ago in my days of paid employment, I used to work in a team of marketing experts with excellence driven, extremely intelligent and competent leadership.

 In our Monday morning meetings, each one of these managers were expected to report on their various bit and obtain guidance, advice and support from other members of the team.

This experience was not a piece of cake; your report must be tight, accurate, flawless and coherent. If by any chance there is a gap in your report or an indication you didn't address an issue you reported efficiently, you’re  definitely going to come under severe fire and criticism by many members of the team, they won’t stop unless and until our director intervened.

Consequently, these meetings became a much revered experience, for some of us it became an emotional struggle or battle as it were, we would work hard crossing the ‘Is’ and dotting the ‘Ts’ to make sure we’re not the scapegoat of any of these meetings.

One of my friends; a colleague then had serious difficulty handling these intense and tension soaked meetings. Every time it was his turn to report his bit, he would immediately begin to sweat profusely. 

He would lose...

item.title: FUNNY BEHAVIORS IN NIGERIA
item.description:
Fellow Nigerians,

rn

Is this how arrests are done? Is there any guideline regarding the arrest of any citizen of this country?

rn

Why do we do things this way? Is this also traceable to bad governance or we just don''t care for one another?

rn

Please share your opinion.

rn

Thank you

item.title: An embedded audio test
item.description:
Lyrics;
Can't stop, addicted to the shindig
Chop top, he says I'm gonna win big
Choose not a life of imitation
Distant cousin to the reservation
Defunct, the pistol that you pay for
This punk, the feeling that you stay for
In time, I want to be your best friend
Eastside love is living on the West End
Knock out, but boy you better come to
Don't die, you know the truth is some do
Go write your message on the pavement
Burn so bright, I wonder what the wave meant
White heat is screaming in the jungle
Complete the motion if you stumble
Go ask the dust for any answers
Come back strong with 50 belly dancers

rn

[Chorus:]
The world I love
The tears I drop
To be part of
The wave can't stop
Ever wonder if it's all for you
The world I love
The trains I hop
To be part of
The wave can't stop
Come and tell me when it's time to

rn

Sweetheart is bleeding in the snow cone
So smart, she's leading me to ozone
Music, the great communicator
Use two sticks to make it in the nature
I'll get you into penetration
The gender of a generation
The birth of every other nation
Worth your weight the gold of meditation
This chapter's gonna be a close one
Smoke rings...
